message.content: This question requires an understanding of the effects of overheating on organisms. Option (C) is the correct answer because when an earthworm is exposed to high temperatures on a sidewalk, it can dry out and die. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs pant to cool themselves down, so it is a mechanism to prevent overheating rather than a result of overheating. Option (B) is incorrect because bears shed fur for reasons related to seasonal changes, not specifically to cool off. Option (D) is incorrect because birds resting after a long flight is a normal behavior and not directly related to overheating.

This question tests knowledge about the effects of extreme heat on different organisms. Option (C) is the correct answer because an earthworm drying up on a sidewalk is an example of an organism becoming too hot and eventually dying. Earthworms require moist environments, so when they are exposed to the heat of a sidewalk, they can quickly dry out and perish. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs pant to cool themselves down, not to the point of death. Option (B) is incorrect because bears shedding fur is a natural process that helps them adapt to changing seasons, not a response to extreme heat. Option (D) is incorrect because birds resting after a long flight is a normal behavior and not directly related to extreme heat.

This question requires knowledge of how heat can negatively affect organisms. Option (A) is incorrect because panting is a mechanism that dogs use to cool themselves down. Option (B) is incorrect because bears shed fur to keep cool in hot weather. Option (D) is incorrect because birds stopping to rest after a long flight is a natural behavior and not necessarily related to heat-induced death.
